event_breakdown:
The Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip on Monday killed at least 25 people, including nine children, and injured 122 others, according to health officials in the coastal enclave.
Heavy bombardment in the last 24 hours has rocked Gaza, as Israel escalates a bloody confrontation with Palestinian armed groups in the occupied West Bank and Jerusalem.
Among the targets in Gaza City were two large housing towers, the al-Jalaa and al-Shorouk buildings, which were flattened by airstrikes.
Airstrikes also killed at least five people, including a journalist who lived in the east of the city.
A leading Israeli human rights group, B'Tselem, estimated that at least 450 Palestinians - including 55 minors - had been killed in Israeli bombardments in Gaza since May 10.
The UN said on Friday that at least least 129 buildings in Gaza had been completely destroyed, with an additional 1,006 housing units damaged.
The security situation has deteriorated significantly with more than 2,900 reported incidents of looting and break-ins since the start of Israel's military offensive, according to the UN.
The UN agency for Palestinian refugees said that 30 education and healthcare facilities had been damaged, including 18 schools and two hospitals, and about 300,000 people had been displaced.

title: Russian UAVs Again Enter NATO Airspace During Drone Attack on Ukraine
message:
Russian troops launched a drone attack on Ukraine early Thursday, July 25, with three of the 38 drones straying into NATO airspace in Romania, according to Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk via Telegram.
The Air Force reported that Russian troops deployed 38 Shahed-131/136 attack UAVs, targeting Ukrainian infrastructure in several regions, including the southern Odesa region and central Ukraine.
The air attack was repelled by anti-aircraft missile troops, electronic warfare units of the Air Force, and mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian Defense Forces.
Russian drones enter Romania, againAdvertisementThe Ukrainian Air Force reported that three more Shahed drones crossed the national border into Romania.
Residents were warned about the danger of falling debris from Russian drones, according to local publication Digi24.
event_breakdown: Russian troops launched a drone attack on Ukraine early Thursday, July 25, with three of the 38 drones straying into NATO airspace in Romania, according to Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk via Telegram.

title: Sniper Targeting Pod Will Become Advanced Communications and Computing Node
message:
Lockheed Martin’s Sniper Advanced Targeting Pod, a mainstay on fourth generation combat aircraft, will be developed into the Sniper Networked Targeting Pod, adding advanced datalink capabilities compatible with fifth generation fighters like the F-35.
A variety of different types of targeting pods are in use across NATO air forces, such as the LITENING, ATFLIR, Damocles and the Sniper Advanced Targeting Pod (ATP).
The Sniper pod is a prolific platform, seeing use by air forces across the world on many different aircraft types.
At Farnborough International Airshow on July 23, 2024, Lockheed Martin unveiled their proposal to develop the existing Sniper ATP design into the Sniper Networked Targeting Pod.
Sniper pods were also seen on F-16s launched to investigate and later shoot down unidentified objects over North America in 2023.

title: Fact check : Netanyahu claims about Rafah in speech to Congress
message:
CNN —In his speech to Congress on Wednesday, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu struck a defiant tone, pledging to carry on with the war in Gaza until Israeli hostages are released and Hamas is eliminated.
He defended Israel’s actions, pushing back against criticism that the war has gone on for too long and resulted in too many civilian casualties.
The incident Netanyahu appeared to refer to occurred in May and killed at least 45 people at a camp for displaced Palestinians.
Israeli officials have been making the claim that Hamas was stealing aid since October.
UN Humanitarian Coordinator Lynn Hastings told CNN then that Hamas wasn’t stealing aid because aid wasn’t coming in.

Netanyahu's speech capped a two-day visit to Washington aimed at highlighting the close relationship between the US and Israel. The Israeli Prime Minister met with US President Joe Biden on Tuesday, with the two leaders signaling strong bipartisan support for Israel as it continues its military campaign in Gaza.
During his speech, Netanyahu vowed to continue to fight Hamas in Gaza until Israeli hostages are released and the militant group is eliminated. He also defended Israel's actions, pushing back against criticism that the war has gone on for too long and resulted in too many civilian casualties.

title: 1 killed , 2 injured in Israeli airstrike on Lebanese village - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, July 25 (Xinhua) -- An Israeli airstrike killed a Hezbollah member and wounded two others on Thursday in the village of Rab Thalathine in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
A civil defense ambulance transported the body of the deceased, identified as Abdullah Mohammad Fakih, and the two wounded to a hospital in the border area.
Military sources noted that Israeli warplanes and air forces conducted three raids on Thursday on three towns and villages in the eastern sector of the border area.
Israeli artillery also bombed seven towns and villages in the eastern, central, and western sectors with about 35 shells, causing material damage and three fires that Civil Defense worked to extinguish.
Early on Thursday, resistance fighters fired anti-aircraft missiles at Israeli warplanes inside Lebanese airspace, forcing them to retreat behind the Lebanese border with Israel, according to Hezbollah.

title: Russian Attacks Kill 3 , Damage Swiss NGO Office in Kharkiv , Ukraine Says
message:
Ukraine's second-largest city and the surrounding region, which borders Russia, have been battered by drone, missile and guided-bomb attacks since Moscow launched its full-scale invasion in February 2022.
Regional police said a strike on the town of Lozova, south of Kharkiv, killed three people and injured six, with rescue operations proceeding into the evening.
The region's governor, Oleh Syniehubov, said an overnight strike destroyed the facade of the Fondation suisse de déminage's office and the ceilings of several of its floors.
Mayor Ihor Terekhov said there had been five separate strikes on the city since Russia's overnight attack.
Russia denies deliberately targeting civilians but thousands have been killed and injured in its 29-month-old invasion of Ukraine.

title: Analysis - Battered Hamas confounds Israel bid to declare victory
message:

message:

Picture: Social mediaBy Flaminia LuckA soldier who was repeatedly stabbed outside an army barracks in Kent has been pictured for the first time.
The attack took place just yards from Brompton Barracks, in Gillingham, home of the 1 Royal School of Military Engineering Regiment.
Read more: British soldier fighting for life after being 'stabbed in frenzied attack outside barracks' - as man, 24, arrestedRead more: Police 'being supported by counter-terror officers' as they investigate stabbing of soldier outside barracksThere is a heavy police presence in the area.

event_breakdown:
Location: Gillingham
Soldier 'stabbed in frenzied attack' outside barracks
A soldier has been airlifted to hospital in a life-threatening condition after being stabbed around 12 times in a "frenzied attack" outside an army barracks in Kent.
The attack took place just yards from Brompton Barracks, in Gillingham, on Sunday morning.
The injured member of the armed forces was taken to hospital in London.
A cordon was put in place and a number of witnesses spoken to by police.
A 24-year-old man from Gillingham was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder, wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm and dangerous driving.
A spokesman for the Metropolitan Police said: "At 0912 on Sunday, 25 June, officers from the Metropolitan Police Service were called to reports of an assault outside Brompton Barracks in Gillingham.
"Police found a 24-year-old man at the scene with stab wounds.
"He remains in a critical but stable condition."
The case has now been handed to the Kent and Essex Serious Crime Directorate.

title: Israeli forces advance in southern Gaza , tanks active in Rafah
message:
CAIRO (Reuters) - Israeli forces advanced deeper into some towns on the eastern side of Khan Younis in southern Gaza on Thursday, hours after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told U.S. lawmakers he was actively engaged in bringing hostages home.
Hamas militants took more than 250 hostages in the early morning raid into southern Israel and killed 1,200 people, according to Israeli tallies.
Israel retaliated by vowing to eradicate Hamas in Gaza in a nine-month war that has killed more than 39,000 Palestinians, Gaza health officials say.
Several were wounded in the eastern towns during Israeli tank and aerial shelling, while an airstrike east of Khan Younis killed four people, Palestinian health officials said.
The Israeli military said forces operating in Khan Younis killed dozens of militants and dismantled around 50 military infrastructures, while it continued activities in Rafah, killing two militants.

title: Japan planning to build missile training site on Pacific island
message:
Japan plans to build a training site for surface-to-ship missile launches on a remote Pacific island, a Defense Ministry official said Thursday, in its latest effort to strengthen the nation's long-range strike capabilities amid China's military assertiveness.
The ministry has already informed local officials of the plan to set up the facilities on Minamitori Island, Japan's easternmost island, approximately 1,900 kilometers southeast of Tokyo, and start its operation in fiscal 2026 or later, the official said.
If realized, the training site would be the first one in the country for missiles with a range of over 100 km, according to the official.
The GSDF has deployed surface-to-ship missile units in Miyako and Ishigaki islands in the southern prefecture of Okinawa, Uruma on Okinawa's main island, and Amami-Oshima Island in the southwestern prefecture of Kagoshima.
Minamitori Island has no civilian population, with only Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force members and Meteorological Agency personnel stationed there.

title: Man charged over stabbing of uniformed Army officer
message:
A 24-year-old man has been charged with the attempted murder of an Army officer in uniform near a barracks (Gareth Fuller/PA)A 24-year-old man has been charged with the attempted murder of an Army officer in uniform near a barracks.
Anthony Esan will appear in court on Thursday over the attack on Lieutenant Colonel Mark Teeton, in Gillingham, Kent, on Tuesday.
The serviceman, in his 40s, is in hospital in a serious but stable condition after being repeatedly stabbed.
Esan, who was arrested near his home in nearby Rochester, has also been charged with possessing an offensive weapon in a public place and will appear at Medway Magistrates’ Court.
Head of the Army General Sir Roly Walker condemned the stabbing as “horrific and unprovoked”, while Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer said he was “shocked and appalled”.

title: Woman , 44 , arrested on suspicion of killing wife with sword in San Dimas

title: Salman Rushdie stabber charged with supporting Hezbollah
message:
Author Salman Rushdie is helped by people after he was stabbed at the ChautauquaThe man accused of stabbing British author Salman Rushdie in 2022 in New York now faces a new charge of supporting the Hezbollah terrorist group, the BBC reported on Wednesday, citing a newly unsealed indictment.
The stabber, Hadi Matar, has been charged with providing material support to Hezbollah in the new indictment.
The indictment said Matar attempted to provide "material support and resources" to Hezbollah, knowing it was a terrorist organization, but did not detail what evidence connected him to the group.
He is also charged with attempted murder and assault for the 2022 attack which left Rushdie blind in one eye .
Rushdie spent a decade in hiding after Iran's spiritual leader, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, issued the 1989 fatwa against him for his book.

Israeli forces retrieved the remains of five Israelis, killed during Hamas's October 7 attack on southern Israel, whose bodies had been taken to the Gaza Strip, the military said Thursday.
The military said the soldiers were killed in combat while fighting the militants on October 7.
Militants also seized 251 hostages, 111 of whom remain in Gaza, including 39 the military says are dead.
The bodies were recovered on Wednesday during an operation in Khan Yunis, the main city in the south of the Gaza Strip, the military said, more than nine months into the Gaza war between Israel and Hamas.
Israel's retaliatory military campaign in Gaza has killed more than 39,100 Palestinians, according to data from the health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza, which does not give details of civilian and militant deaths.

title: Pentagon to review 20 Medals of Honor from Wounded Knee Massacre
message:
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin directed the Pentagon to review the 20 Medals of Honor awarded to U.S. troops for their actions at Wounded Knee in 1890, when soldiers killed and injured between 350 and 375 Lakota men, women and children.
“And that’s what is intended by the review that the secretary directed, which is to ensure that we go back and review each of these medals in a rigorous and individualized manner.”The killings, referred to as the Wounded Knee Massacre, occurred Dec. 29, 1890, near Wounded Knee Creek in South Dakota.
Medals of Honor for soldiers who perpetrated Wounded Knee massacre may be rescindedThe panel reviewing the Medals of Honor will comprise five experts, including two from the Department of the Interior, Austin’s memo states.
The Pentagon noted that this isn’t the first time Medals of Honor have come under scrutiny.
In 1916, Congress ordered the Army to review all Medals of Honor awarded since the Civil War.

title: International arms fuelling Sudan civil war : Amnesty
message:
(Photo: EPA-EFE / Amel Pain)China, Russia, Serbia, Türkiye, the United Arab Emirates and Yemen are fuelling the 15-month-old civil war in Sudan by constantly supplying weapons to the belligerents, Amnesty International says in a new report.
Amnesty International has documented civilian casualties in both indiscriminate strikes and direct attacks on civilians.
Based on the markings found on modified G3 rifles used by armed groups in Sudan, Amnesty said it had been able to identify small arms recently transferred from Yemen.
Several of the arms companies cited by Amnesty International denied to the organisation that they had sold arms to Sudan.
And it said that apart from the obligations of governments to prevent their companies transferring arms to Sudan, the arms companies were themselves obliged not to do so.

message:
But how did a Yemeni drone reach the heart of Israel’s most fortified region and strike a blow to Israeli military pride?
The name is deeply symbolic as it references the ancient port city of Jaffa, also known as Yaffa in Arabic, which now forms part of modern-day Tel Aviv.

Yemeni Drone Strike on Tel Aviv, Israel
A Yemeni drone strike on Tel Aviv, Israel, has hit the heart of the country's most fortified region, causing damage to the Israeli military's pride. The symbolic name given to the drone references the ancient port city of Jaffa, now known as Yaffa, that forms modern-day Tel Aviv. The drone, which was able to reach Tel Aviv from Yemen due to a powerful engine, struck a civilian target, revealing a lack of intelligence on potential military targets in the Yemeni capital. The Israeli strike on Hodeidah Port was based on an assumption that it would deter a Yemeni counterattack, but it underestimated the Yemeni government's resolve.

title: Iraq : Rockets fired at base which houses US forces
message:
Multiple rockets were launched at Iraq's Ain al-Asad airbase which houses US-led forces late on Thursday, US and Iraqi sources said, according to the Reuters news agency.
Two US officials said the base itself had not been struck in the attack.
The Ain al-Asad base came under attack by two armed drones last week, but that attack was the first one against US forces in Iraq since early February, when Iranian-backed groups in Iraq announced they would stop their attacks against US troops.
That announcement came two days after a drone attack in Jordan killed three US service members and wounded dozens of others.
Before stopping their attacks in February, the pro-Iranian militias in Iraq had upped the volume of their attacks, and launched dozens of attacks on bases in Iraq and Syria which host US troops.

message:

Decades later, in 1994, the then-Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command tried to search for remains but was unsuccessful.

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas 2024 : 10 facts about Kargil War you must know
message:
The Kargil War stands as a poignant chapter in Indian history, forever etched in the collective memory of the nation.
It pays tribute to the bravery and valor of the Kargil War heroes who spearheaded Operation Vijay, culminating in the triumph of the Indian Armed Forces, albeit at a heavy cost.
Each year, on July 26, India commemorates this victory as Kargil Vijay Diwas, a solemn occasion dedicated to honoring the courageous soldiers who made the ultimate sacrifice for their motherland.
Timeline: The Kargil conflict took place between May and July 1999 in the Kargil district of Jammu and Kashmir, India.
Kargil Vijay Diwas is a reminder of the sacrifice and dedication of the Indian Armed Forces and a testament to the enduring spirit of the nation.

title: Deadpool & Wolverine review :  Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have the biggest laugh in this multiverse caper , writes BRIAN VINER
message:
Deadpool & Wolverine (15, 127 mins)Verdict: Super smugRating:While watching the new Marvel spectacular Deadpool & Wolverine, starring Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman as the two title characters, it occurred to me that maybe there is a more expressive way of rating films than giving them stars.
As for Deadpool & Wolverine, I would have to reach for three self-satisfied smirks.
And yet for all that, Shawn Levy's Deadpool & Wolverine is sometimes funny, sporadically very funny, and introduces a splendidly improbable new baddie in the form of Emma Corrin's Cassandra Nova, as bald as an egg but much harder to crack.
And to save the galaxy from evil Cassandra, he joins forces with Jackman's grumpy Logan, aka Wolverine, long presumed dead.
Deadpool & Wolverine is in cinemas now.
event_breakdown:
Super smug
Three smirks

title: Why is US Air Force moving more F - 16 near Korean DMZ , forming  Super Squadron ?
message:
The US Air Force is reportedly bolstering its presence near the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) that separates North and South Korea by shifting nine additional F-16 fighters to Osan Air Base .
"The 25th Fighter Squadron at Osan remains the only internationally based unit to operate A-10 aircraft.
While the timeline for the continued operation of A-10s at the base is uncertain, maintenance contracts with South Korean firms extend until 2029.
Osan first received F-16s in 1988, with Kunsan being the first overseas base to convert from F-4 Phantoms to F-16s in 1981.
The current modernization efforts include significant upgrades to the F-16 fleet, enhancing their capabilities with new radar and display technologies.

title: Wounded in a strike that killed her family , a 2 - year - old joins Gaza ranks of thousands of orphans
message:
Wounded in a strike that killed her family, a 2-year-old joins Gaza's ranks of thousands of orphansDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The 2-year-old toddler lay on a foil blanket, her face covered with salve for her burns and her little body riddled with scars from shrapnel.
She’s the lone survivor of an Israeli strike that hit their family home in central Gaza, killing her parents, her two sisters and her brother, along with a brother of her mother.
She spoke at nearby Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah, where the overwhelmed staff rushed around her dealing with influxes of wounded.
The Israeli military rarely comments on individual strikes.

title: Ukraine Downs 20 Shahed Drones Overnight Friday
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Ukraine's air defense forces intercepted 20 Russian kamikaze drones in the early hours of Friday, July 26.
In total, the enemy launched an Iskander-M ballistic missile and 22 one-way attack drones of the Shahed type.
The missile was launched from Russia's Rostov region, targeting Ukraine's Donetsk region, while kamikaze drones were launched from Cape Chauda (occupied Crimea) and Kursk (Russia).
The air raid was repelled by mobile fire groups of Ukraine's Defense Forces and air defense units of the country's Air Force.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, an air raid alert went off across Kyiv region overnight Friday after a group of enemy drones was spotted in the airspace.

title: N . J . man accused of stabbing Salman Rushdie facing additional terrorism charges
message:
The New Jersey man accused of attacking Salman Rushdie with a knife in 2022 has now been charged with terrorism after federal authorities alleged that he tried to assassinate the author on behalf of a Muslim terrorist group.
Hadi Matar, 26, of Fairview, appeared in federal court on Wednesday on three separate terrorism charges, the U.S. Attorney’s Office District of New Jersey said in a news release.
Federal authorities allege that Matar attempted to carry out an assassination on Rushdie because of the 2006 endorsement from the Hizballah leader.
The three federal charges Matar faces are committing an act of terrorism transcending national boundaries, attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization and providing material support to terrorists.
Rushdie, now 77, was blinded in one eye as a result of the stabbing, the Associated Press reported.

On February 4, 2022, Salman Rushdie was attacked by a knife-wielding man while on stage at the Jaipur Literature Festival. The attacker was subdued by security guards. The author was unharmed, but injured a security guard.

title: Jose Martinez - Vazquez pleads guilty in stabbing on Setauket - Port Jefferson Station Greenway
message:
A Port Jefferson man pleaded guilty Thursday to the fatal stabbing of a landscaper found on the Setauket-Port Jefferson Station Greenway trail in 2021 while his girlfriend served as the lookout, county prosecutors said.
Jose Martinez-Vazquez, 25, pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in the death of Benjamin Flores-Mendez, 39, of Port Jefferson Station, authorities said.
"These defendants conspired to brutally take the life of Benjamin Flores-Mendez, and then did so in a place where Suffolk County residents should feel safe to walk, hike, or bike," said Suffolk County District Attorney Ray Tierney.
Martinez-Vazquez's girlfriend, Tiffany Diaz-Cabrera, 21, also of Port Jefferson Station, pleaded guilty to first-degree manslaughter on April 22.
Prosecutors said Martinez-Vazquez and Diaz-Cabrera "targeted" Flores-Mendez and followed him into the Port Jefferson Station entrance of the greenway walking trail on June 17, 2021.

title: Europe war on tourism spreads to Portugal and Switzerland
message:
Europe's war on tourism has now spread to Portugal and Switzerland.
Anger is bubbling in the municipality of Sintra, found in southern Portugal's Sintra Mountains, which is home to less than 400,000 people.
Residents are complaining that the town has become clogged by 'mass tourism' and turned into 'a mere congested amusement park,' according to The Times.
Now, after years of calling on authorities to address the issue - members of a local action group have said ''Enough is Enough!'
and are calling for measures to be taken to combat mass tourism to the region, with one saying 'guerrilla action is needed'.

message:

title: FSB Arrests Suspect Linked to Moscow Car Bombing on Ukrainian Orders
message:
Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) announced on Friday the arrest of Yevgeniy Serebryakov, who stands accused of orchestrating a car bombing on directives from Ukrainian authorities.
The FSB released footage showing a handcuffed Serebryakov disembarking from a plane from Turkiye, under the watch of masked officers.
Turkish officials reported that Serebryakov was detained following Moscow's request, having arrived in Bodrum hours after a car bomb detonated in Moscow.
The FSB alleges Serebryakov was acting on orders from Ukraine's spy agency and distributed a video of his supposed confessions, though the claims could not be independently verified.
Ukrainian officials have refuted any involvement in the incident.

Patients and doctors recounted the horror they felt during last month's Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children's hospital in the Ukrainian capital.

At least one child died and 17 people were injured in the 8 August strike, which was condemned by the UN as an act of "aggression" and condemned by Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskiy as a "crime against humanity".

Since the strike, the German government accepted 12 children in need of medical care for treatment in six different German hospitals, Federal Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said on Tuesday during his visit to Kyiv.

Prior to the minister's visit, more than 40 German doctors and nurses were sent to Ukraine to provide their help in the war against Russia, according to information shared by the German Embassy in Kyiv.

"In particular, the money will be used to reconstruct the hospital, as it has now been completely destroyed. They must move the children out. We want to change that and we hope that we will succeed," said Lauterbach.

Six days after the hospital was hit, Grischa Altmann, a journalist from ZDF (a public service German television network), went into the building. The images filmed that day formed part of the documentary series "Ukraine Report", which was aired on 14 August.

title: It A Recession Not A Depression | Armstrong Economics
message:
A recent poll by Affirm found that 3 in 5 Americans believe the US is in a recession, and most believe that recession began in March 2023.
Another poll from Guardian/Harris found that 56% of Americans feel that the recession has already arrived.
About 68% of respondents from the Affirm poll believe inflation has caused the recession, but few realize what causes inflation.
The poll saw similar sentiments during the Great Recession when 37% of Americans feared the next round of bills.
We are in a recession but not a depression.

Russia is a suspect in the Olympics sabotage - Brian Snyder/REUTERSRussia will be one of the prime suspects in Friday morning’s attacks on the French rail network, as suspicions swirl that Vladimir Putin has been yearning for a chance to humiliate Emmanuel Macron.

title: Ukraine General Staff confirms strike on Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea
message:
The Armed Forces of Ukraine launched an attack on the Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea, which the Russians used for launching airstrikes on the territory of Ukraine, on 25-26 July at night.
Source: General Staff of the Armed Forces of UkraineQuote: "At night, the units of the Rocket Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, jointly with other units of the defence forces of Ukraine, launched an attack on the Saky airbase in temporarily occupied Crimea."
Information on the consequences of the strike is currently being clarified.
The Ukrainian General Staff adds that the airbase was covered by "advanced" Russian air defence systems, which once again failed to protect an important Russian military facility.
Background: A threat of ballistic missile attack was announced in temporarily occupied Crimea on the night of 25-26 July.

title: JUST IN : Bomb explosion injures girl in Yobe
message:
An explosion, suspected to be caused by a planted Improvised Explosive Device, has occurred at the popular Buni Yadi market in Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State.
Channels Television reported that a resident of Buni, Ali Hassan said that the incident happened at around 12.30pm on Friday, injuring a girl.
He further explained the only victim of the explosion, is currently receiving treatment at one of the health facilities in Buni Yadi.
He stressed the incident was a planted IED and not a suicide bombing incident.
Buni Yadi, located 54 kilometres from Damaturu, the state capital, was the most severely affected local government area in Yobe State during the two years it was under Boko Haram insurgent control.

title: Israel is spying on Hezbollah commanders and killing them one by one
message:
An Israeli drone fired a missile that hit a Renault van in southern Lebanon.
The three hits last week were part of a particularly violent day across southern Lebanon, where Hezbollah, the Shiite paramilitary faction and political party, has tussled with Israel for more than nine months.
Since Oct. 7 — when Hamas made its brutal attack on southern Israel and Hezbollah launched what it calls a “solidarity campaign “ — Israel has picked off some two dozen Hezbollah commanders.
He added that Hezbollah’s security is so tight that Israel would almost have to be getting its information from insiders.
Since early October, when Hezbollah began launching attacks into northern Israel and Israel retaliated, nearly 400 Hezbollah members and more than 100 Lebanese civilians have died in the fighting.

title: Israeli troops battle Palestinian fighters in Gaza city of Khan Younis
message:
Smoke rises over Gaza, as seen from IsraelJERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israeli troops battled Palestinian fighters in Khan Younis in southern Gaza and destroyed tunnels and other infrastructure, as they sought to suppress small militant units that have continued to hit troops with mortar fire, the military said on Friday.
The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) said troops had killed around 100 Palestinian fighters since Israeli troops began their latest operation in Khan Younis on Monday, which continued as pressure mounted for a deal to halt the fighting.
The Islamic Jihad armed wing said it fired rockets toward the southern Israeli city of Ashkelon and other Israeli towns near Gaza.
Medics said at least six Palestinians were killed in Israeli strikes in eastern Khan Younis.
Even while the fighting continued around Khan Younis and Rafah in the south, in the northern part of the enclave, Israeli tanks pushed into the Tel Al-Hawa suburb west of Gaza city, residents said.
event_breakdown:
* Israeli troops battled Palestinian fighters in Khan Younis in southern Gaza and destroyed tunnels and other infrastructure as they sought to suppress small militant units that have continued to hit troops with mortar fire.
* The Islamic Jihad armed wing said it fired rockets toward the southern Israeli city of Ashkelon and other Israeli towns near Gaza.
* Israeli tanks pushed into the Tel Al-Hawa suburb west of Gaza city, residents said.

title: Senate Committee Seeks Information From Secret Service , FBI , Pennsylvania Police About Trump Shooting
message:
The Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee has requested information from eight federal, state, and local agencies regarding the shooting.
The HSGAC that day issued letters to eight federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies demanding information on their activities, communications, and records pertaining to the shooting.
“The senators are seeking information on security preparations, intelligence gathering on potential violence prior to the attack, and detailed explanations of the agencies’ security response,” Sens.
The HSGAC also wrote to the FBI, which is leading the investigation into the alleged shooter, Thomas Matthew Crooks, who was shot and killed by the Secret Service after the attempted assassination.
Neither the Secret Service nor the FBI responded to requests for comment by publication time.

title: Boston man arrested for a shooting in Dorchester earlier this month
message:
A Boston man was arrested Thursday for allegedly shooting a man in Dorchester earlier this month, officials said.
Jajuan Holliman-Wiggins, 23, of Roslindale, was arrested shortly before noon by members of the Youth Violence Strike Force, police said.
He was wanted on a warrant for assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, illegal gun possession, an discharging a firearm within 500 feet of a dwelling, police said.

Holliman-Wiggins is being charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, illegal gun possession, and discharging a firearm within 500 feet of a dwelling, police said.

title: Four teenagers sentenced for killing 16 - year - old schoolboy out of revenge
message:
Four teenagers have been sentenced for killing a 16-year-old boy out of revenge in a fatal attack where a single stab “pierced his heart”.
Kennie Carter died after being stabbed in the chest once in Thirlmere Avenue, Stretford, Greater Manchester, on the evening of January 22 2022.
On January 22 the four convicted teenagers stole bikes from a block of flats, and were heard shouting “this is revenge”.
Addressing the defendants, the judge said: “The stabbing occurred because of a perceived grievance between Kennie Carter and his associates and with the four of you.
“I am sure that the knife used to stab Kennie Carter was your knife which you took with you to use in revenge.”

title: Air Defense : Quality and Quantity of Ukrainian Air Defenses
message:
July 25, 2024: Since early 2022, Ukrainians have survived Russian missile and air strikes on critical targets but the intensity of Russian missile and air strikes meant that Ukraine is in danger of running out of air defense missile stocks.
As Ukraine’s supply of air defense missiles declined, Ukrainian air defense systems were less capable of defeating or threatening Russian air strikes.
Because scarce Ukrainian air defense systems were unable to cover all areas, Russian attacks on power plants succeeded against the Trypilska Thermal Power Plant, which was destroyed.
The success of the Russian strikes was made possible by the severe depletion of Ukraine’s air defense systems and munitions.
The Ukrainian air defense systems are under constant attack by Russian missile and air attacks so the Ukrainians require regular replenishment of their air defense missile supplies to survive continued Russian attacks.
event_breakdown: Ukraine’s defense ministry and Russia-backed separatists accuse each other of striking targets in the eastern separatist territories known as Donbas, killing four people.

According to ISPR, the killed terrorist was a close associate of Khawarji Gul Bahadur and was actively involved in numerous terrorist activities in the area including target killing of Malik Sher Muhammad, grandson of Faqir of Ippi last year as well as facilitation of suicide bombing attack in North Waziristan in March this year which resulted in shahadat of seven brave soldiers.
Sanitization operation is being conducted to eliminate any other terrorist found in the area as Security Forces of Pakistan remain determined to eliminate the menace of terrorism from the country.

title: Russian car bomb suspect extradited from Turkey
message:
- A Russian man suspected of carrying out a car bombing that wounded two people in Moscow on July 24, 2024 has been arrested by Turkish police, Turkey's Interior Minister said.
The suspected bomber fled to Turkey after carrying out the crime and was detained by law enforcement shortly after arriving, Turkish Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya posted on X.
(Photo by Demiroren News AAgency / AFP)A Russian man suspected of carrying out a car bombing that wounded two people in Moscow has been extradited from Turkey, the interior ministry said Friday.
Several Russian military and pro-Kremlin public figures have been targeted in car bombings since Moscow launched its offensive on Ukraine in February 2022.
Ukraine typically denies responsibility but often cheers attacks on Russian officials and military personnel.

title: Indianapolis man sentenced to 66 years for stabbing IMPD officers
message:
Indianapolis man sentenced to 66 years for stabbing IMPD officersINDIANAPOLIS (WISH) — An Indianapolis man was sentenced on Thursday after he attempted to kill two officers on Dec. 1, 2021.
Deonta Williams, 22, was sentenced to 66 years in federal prison after pleading guilty to two counts of attempted murder and one count of prisoner possessing a deadly weapon.
When officers arrived, they spoke to Williams, who had placed the 911 call.
Williams claimed to have been harassed and directed the officers down the street, according to a release.
When the officers went down the street, Williams attacked them both, stabbing one officer in the neck and one in the chest.

title: Woman arrested in butcher knife attack at Grand Island home
message:
Woman arrested in butcher knife attack at Grand Island homeCourtesy Hall County Department of CorrectionsLINCOLN, Neb.
(KLKN) – A woman was arrested Thursday in a stabbing at a Grand Island home earlier this month, police say.
On July 15 around 8 p.m., a 21-year-old woman was arguing with Julissa Trevino at a home near 11th Street and St. Paul Road.
Police said Trevino grabbed a butcher knife and pointed it at the victim.
She then attacked her with the knife, leaving cuts to her head, face and arm, according to police.

title: Honoring Heroes : Must - Visit Military Museums in India for Kargil Vijay Diwas -
message:
The nation, India, we call our home today, has been so because of the bravery that our soldiers in the Indian Army, Navy and Airforce have been displaying n the borders.
Air Force Museum, Palam, DelhiThe history of the Indian air force is on display in the Air Force Museum at Palam Air Force Station, which is located outside of Delhi’s downtown.
All of the IAF’s equipment, including actual war trophies, radio detection and range apparatus, and commandeered military vehicles, has also been on display.
Older aircraft that are normally inaccessible to the general public can be seen if you are fortunate enough to visit the museum on Annual Air Force Day.
The museum is also home to a Pakistani letter box, which was brought by the Indian army as a souvenir of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971.

title: Agnipath Scheme no solution to Army needs , say Cong leaders
message:
Agnipath Scheme no solution to Army’s needs, say Cong leadersNew Delhi: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the opposition for playing politics on the Agnipath Scheme, the Congress hit back saying that it does not solve the needs of the Army.
Another Congress leader Karti Chidambaram criticised the Prime Minister for defending the Agnipath Scheme at an event meant to honour the Kargil War soldiers.
Modern warfare requires fully-trained soldiers, and the scheme does not give full-trained soldiers.
The Agniveer Scheme does not solve the needs of the Army,” Chidambaram said.
Launched in 2022, the Agnipath scheme was designed to recruit personnel for short-term service in the Armed Forces.
